definition: Nikkei, abbr. for Nikkei Shimbun 日本經濟新聞|日本经济新闻[Ri4 ben3 Jing1 ji4 Xin1 wen2]/abbr. for Nikkei 225 index 日經指數|日经指数[Ri4 jing1 zhi3 shu4]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

pinyin: ri4 jing1 ping2 jun1 zhi3 shu4
Ri4 jing1 ping2 jun1 zhi3 shu4
ri4 jing1 ping2 jun1 zhi3 shu4
Ri4 jing1 ping2 jun1 zhi3 shu4

sentences.english: The argumentation on"holiday economic"had aroused a violent disturbance in China.
sentences.chinese: 关于“假日经济”的大讨论在中国引起了轩然大波。

sentences.english: Holiday economics brought a lot of profits to hotels and tourism.
sentences.chinese: 假日经济给宾馆和旅游业带来了很大利润。

sentences.english: It was the biggest one-day loss for the Nikkei since 1987.
sentences.chinese: 这是日经指数1987年以来最大单日跌幅。

sentences.english: In Asia - Tokyo's Nikkei was up nearly 3 percent.
sentences.chinese: 在亚洲，东京日经指数上涨了近3个百分点。

sentences.english: Holiday tourism is the principle part of holiday economy.
sentences.chinese: 假日旅游是假日经济的主要形式。

sentences.english: Holiday economy is the economic life of a new topic.
sentences.chinese: 假日经济是我国经济生活中的一个新话题。

sentences.english: In Japan, the Nikkei Index was down by almost 3% in midafternoon .
sentences.chinese: 日本的日经指数在正午下降了大约3%。

sentences.english: Holiday economy has been the focal topic in the field of economics.
sentences.chinese: “假日经济”已成为经济界的一个热门话题。

sentences.english: The Nikkei is also climbing mostly upwards.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，日经指数也正在向上爬升。

sentences.english: Holiday economy is the important constituent parts of the third estate economy.
sentences.chinese: 假日经济是第三产业经济的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the holiday economy has certain negative impacts.
sentences.chinese: 同时，假日经济也存在某些负面影响。

sentences.english: Japan's Nikkei Index closed less than one percent higher Friday.
sentences.chinese: 日本日经指数星期五以上升不到一个百分点收盘。

sentences.english: Holiday economy injected fresh energy to the consumption growth.
sentences.chinese: 假日经济为消费增长注入新的活力。

sentences.english: It was down as much as 454 points, or 5%, before rebounding.
sentences.chinese: 反弹前，日经指数已下跌454点，跌幅达5%。

definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
the other day/a few days ago
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
Nikkei Shimbun, Japanese equivalent of Financial Times
pinyin: Ri4 ben3 Jing1 ji4 Xin1 wen2

definition: late last year/the end of last year
to receive mail/to receive a telegraph
